description: [Status: stable] [Name: yield-in-init] [Message: __init__ method is a generator] What it does Checks for __init__ methods that are turned into generators by the inclusion of yield or yield from expressions. Why is this bad? The __init__ method is the constructor for a given Python class, responsible for initializing, rather than creating, new objects. The __init__ method has to return None. By including a yield or yield from expression in an __init__, the method will return a generator object when called at runtime, resulting in a runtime error. Example class InitIsGenerator: def __init__(self, i): yield i
